member.name: SYSTEM_BATTERY_STATE
member.summary: Contains information about the current state of the system battery.

member.name: SYSTEM_BATTERY_STATE.AcOnLine
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, the system battery charger is currently operating on external power.

member.name: SYSTEM_BATTERY_STATE.BatteryPresent
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, at least one battery is present in the system.

member.name: SYSTEM_BATTERY_STATE.Charging
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, a battery is currently charging.

member.name: SYSTEM_BATTERY_STATE.Discharging
member.summary: If this member is TRUE, a battery is currently discharging.

member.name: SYSTEM_BATTERY_STATE.MaxCapacity
member.summary: The theoretical capacity of the battery when new.

member.name: SYSTEM_BATTERY_STATE.RemainingCapacity
member.summary: The estimated remaining capacity of the battery.

member.name: SYSTEM_BATTERY_STATE.Rate
member.summary: The current rate of discharge of the battery, in mW. A nonzero, positive rate indicates charging; a negative rate indicates discharging. Some batteries report only discharging rates. This value should be treated as a LONG as it can contain negative values (with the high bit set).

member.name: SYSTEM_BATTERY_STATE.EstimatedTime
member.summary: The estimated time remaining on the battery, in seconds.

member.name: SYSTEM_BATTERY_STATE.DefaultAlert1
member.summary: The manufacturer's suggestion of a capacity, in mWh, at which a low battery alert should occur. Definitions of low vary from manufacturer to manufacturer. In general, a warning state will occur before a low state, but you should not assume that it always will. To reduce risk of data loss, this value is usually used as the default setting for the critical battery alarm.

member.name: SYSTEM_BATTERY_STATE.DefaultAlert2
member.summary: The manufacturer's suggestion of a capacity, in mWh, at which a warning battery alert should occur. Definitions of warning vary from manufacturer to manufacturer. In general, a warning state will occur before a low state, but you should not assume that it always will. To reduce risk of data loss, this value is usually used as the default setting for the low battery alarm.
